div.l: I wot wel by the cradell I haue mys goo
Here lith the Meller and his wif also
And forth he goth a xxᵗʸ deuel way
Vnto the bed there as the Meller lay
And wende haue cropen̄ by his felaw Iohn
And by the Meller in he crepe anon̄
He caught him by the nekke and softe he spak
He seid thou Iohn thou swynes hed awak
For cristes soule and here a noble game
For by that lord that callid is seint Iame
As I haue thries in this short niȝt
Swyued the meller douȝter bolt vp riȝt
While thou hast as a coward ben agast
Ye false harlot qduod the Miller hast
False traitoᵘur false clerk qduod he
Thou shalt be dede by goddes dignite
Who durst be so bold to disparage
My douȝter that is come of such lynage
And by the throte bolle he cauȝt Aleyn
And he hent him dispitously agein
And on the nose he smote with his fist
Doun̄ ran the blody streem be his brist
And in the flore with nose and mouth to broke
They walwe as don̄ ij pigges in a poke
And vp thei gon̄ and doun̄ agein anon̄
Till that the Miller sporned at a stoon̄
And doun̄ he fill bakward vpon his wif
That wist no thing of this nice strif
For she was falle a slepe a litell wiȝt
With Iohn the clerc that waked had al the niȝt
And with the fall out of hir slepe she braied
Helpe holi croys of Bromholme she saide
In manus tuas lord to the I calle
Awake Symon̄ the fend is on me falle
